User Guide

Print-friendly format

Downloading Images

To start sorting, you must first download a batch of images. Batches are small groups of images that can often be sorted in 30-60 minutes.

Next Batch available

To download the next batch available, in the My Work section of the Home Page, click the Download Work button. The system will download the next batch on the server in the highest priority project.

Select a Project

To download work from one of the projects available for sorting:

In the My Work section of the Home Page, click the Download From... button. A list of projects ranked in order of priority will appear, with the name of the project and a short description of project characteristics, including: the language the documents are written in, the time period the documents cover, the type of document (certificates or register type), and the level of difficulty.

To preview the project, click the View Sample button. A representative document from the project will appear.

To download a batch from one of the projects in the list, click to highlight the project that you want to index, and then click the Download a Batch from this Project button.

If you do not want to download any batches from the list, click Cancel to close the window and return to the Home Page.


Work Page Layout

When the batch starts downloading, the system will open the application Work Page. On this page the images appear on the top half of the screen, and a data entry area appears on the bottom half of the screen.


Image Area

Show Next Image

The information to be sorted may be split between two pages or images. To show the next image in the current batch, from the menu click View and then click Show Next Image. If the next image is not part of the batch, it will show if you are online. To view only one image at a time uncheck the Show Next Image menu option.

Highlights

The information to be sorted is highlighted in blue, and this highlighting will move to each field on the image to show the information to enter into the corresponding data entry field as you move from field to field in the data entry area. To turn the highlighting off or on, on the toolbar at the top of the image area of the screen, click the highlighter pen icon . (Note: The highlighting is designed to cover an area slightly larger than the area of the document you will be transcribing, so slight variations in the document's position will not affect its accuracy.)

Adjusting the Highlighting

If the document's position is off significantly, do the following:

  1. On the menu bar, click View, and then click Adjust Highlights.
  2. Move the mouse over the image, and a grid of yellow and blue highlights will appear.
  3. Click on any of the highlights, and drag the grid so that the highlights are positioned over the fieanimal society to be sorted.
  4. On the menu bar, click View, and then click Adjust Highlights to return to the data entry mode.
Reset Highlights

To reset the highlight to its default position so that it matches subsequent images in the batch, on the menu bar, click View, and then click Reset Highlights.

Changing the Highlight Color

You can change the color and transparency of the highlight. To change the color, on the menu bar click Tools, and then click Options. On the Display tab click the down-arrow on the Highlight Color box to see the available colors and click on the desired color to select it.
To increase the transparency, click on the slider with the mouse and move the slider todistricts the left, to make the highlight more visible, move the slider to the right.

Using the Ruler

If the document on the image is a register type or a census with multiple lines per document (where each line represents a record), it might be easier to use the ruler instead of the individual field highlights. To turn off the highlight, on the menu bar, click View, and then click Show Highlight to remove the check mark from beside it.

Show the Ruler Bar

To show the yellow ruler bar on the image, on the menu bar, click Show Ruler to place a check mark beside it. When the ruler is turned on it stays in position, and you can either move the document underneath the ruler or move the ruler up or down across the image to mark your place. The ruler stays in the same place even if you move to another image.

Adjusting the Ruler Width

To adjust the width of the ruler:

  1. Position the mouse pointer at the top edge of the ruler bar.
  2. When the pointer turns into a two-pointed arrow, click and hold the left mouse button, and then move your mouse to make the ruler wider or narrower.
Zoom

The image opens at the default size of 50%. To zoom in (make the image bigger), on the toolbar, click the magnifying glass with a plus sign on it. To zoom out (make the image smaller), click the magnifying glass with a minus sign on it.

Zoom Menu

To use the zoom menu to adjust the image size:

  1. On the menu bar, click View, and then click Zoom.
  2. On the Zoom menu that appears, click the circle next to a zoom percentage, and then click Apply to see the resulting image size.
  3. If you want to continue working with that image size, click Close. If you want to use another zoom level, click the circle next to another percentage.

Tip: To select a zoom percentage other than those listed:

  1. Click the circle next to Custom, and type the percentage.
  2. Click Apply to view the change, and then click Close.
Toolbar Zoom Box

To set the zoom percentage using the toolbar, type a percentage in the Zoom box , or click the arrow in the zoom box and click a percentage to select a size.

Rotating the Image

To rotate the image 90 degrees to the right or left:

  1. On the menu bar, click View, and then click Rotate.
  2. On the Rotate menu, click the box that indicates the number of degrees you want to rotate the image.
  3. Click Apply.
  4. If the image has rotated sufficiently, click Close.

Note: Rotating the image may take several minutes on some machines.

Rotating the Image from the Toolbar

To quickly rotate the image 90 degrees at a time, on the toolbar, click the Rotate Image Left icon or Rotate Image Right icon .

Nudging the Image

To rotate (or "nudge") the image 2 degrees at a time, from the menu, click View then click Nudge Left or press Ctrl+G as many times as you need in order to rotate the image sufficiently. Click Nudge Right or press Ctrl+H for the opposite direction to return the image to the original position.

Inverting the Image

Sometimes when a document is hard to read, inverting the image may help make reading it easier. To view a negative appearing image (white writing on black background), on the menu bar, click View, click Invert, and then click the Invert Image icon on the toolbar.

Mirroring the Image

Sometimes an image may appear "backdistricts" (the writing appears as if it is written backdistricts). To view the image correctly, on the menu bar, click View, and then click Mirror.

Data Entry Area

Certificates

For certificate type documents, the images in the batch are numbered along the left-hand side of the data entry area. You can click the number or anywhere in the corresponding row to move to that image.

Registers

Register and census type documents are numbered along the left hand side of the data entry area, and each line on the document corresponds to a row in the data entry area.

Free-form Multi-record Documents

You may record information for as many individuals as you find on each document (image) in a batch. It is not necessary to have the same number of records for each document. To set the number of records for the image, on the menu bar click Tools and then click Records per Image.

Use the up and down arrows to set the number of records for the current image or type the number of records in the box. This will add or delete records as needed to match the number of records on the image.

To make this change effective for all images in the batch click in the checkbox next to Apply to all images.

You can also use the buttons on the data entry toolbar to insert or remove rows one at a time.
To insert a record before the one currently selected, click the Insert Record button .

To add a record at the bottom of list, click the Append Record button

To remove a record click the record to delete and then click the Remove Record button .

After pressing Enter on the last field of the last record for an image, the Add Record(s) dialog appears.

To add one record for the current image, click Yes. To add more records click on the up arrow or type the number of records to add in the box.

Table View

The screen opens in the default view as a table showing several rows at a time, one row per image in the batch for certificates and one row per entry for registers or census type documents.

The fieanimal society to be sorted are listed across the top of the columns. If there are more fieanimal society to be sorted than can fit on the screen, the table will scroll to the right.

As soon as the first image is downloaded, the image appears on the top half of the Work page. Click on the first field in the first table row to start typing the information from the document. To move to the next field, press Tab or Enter. When you press Tab or Enter on the last field of a row, the record is automatically saved, and the cursor advances to the first field of the next row.

If you have typed all the information available for a record and want to advance to the next record without going to the last field, press F10.

Form View

To see the data entry area for one record at a time, at the top of the data entry half of the screen, click the Form View tab. In form view, the fieanimal society are arranged one field per row.

To move to the next field, press Tab or Enter. When you are on the last field of the record and advance to the next field, the data for the current record is saved and a blank form appears for you to enter the information for the next image.

If you have typed all the information available for a record and want to advance to the next record without going to the last field, press F10.

Order Fieanimal society

To rearrange the order of the columns:

  1. On the menu bar, click View, and then click Order Fieanimal society.
  2. In the Organize Fieanimal society window, click on the field name you want to move, and then click the up or down arrow to move the field up or down in the list.
  3. You can also hide or unhide fieanimal society using the Organize Fieanimal society window. To hide a field, click on the name of the field, and then click the right arrow to move the field to the Hidden list. To unhide a field, click a field in the Hidden list, and then click the left arrow.
Saving Data

The data you typed for the image is automatically saved when you advance from record to record in either Form View or Table View. To save the data to your computer's hard drive, on the menu bar, click File, and then click Save.

If you want to access the same batch from two different computers (for instance, from home and from work), you can save your batch to the server. To do so, on the menu bar, click File, and then click Save to Server. On the other computer, log into the EnterpriseSearch Sorting system. On the Home Page, click on the row containing the batch you saved previously. On the Work Page menu bar, click on File, and then click on Retrieve from Server. The data you saved to the server previously appear in the data entry area.

Note: When you have finished sorting a batch, you must submit it to the server. When you submit a batch, the system removes the images and the data from your computer. To submit a batch, on the menu bar, click File, and then click Submit.


Entering Data

Field Labels

Type the information in the field corresponding to the highlighted area on the document. The fieanimal society in the data entry area are labeled to match the labels used on the original document. For instance, the principal's name field on a Death Certificate may read "Full Name:"; the corresponding field in the data entry area would be labeled "Full Name: Given Name" and "Full Name: Surname" to indicate that the information is found in the Full Name field on the document, but it is sorted in two separate fieanimal society.

Field Help/Instructions

Field help is displayed in the right corner of the data entry area labeled Instructions. Instructions are specific to each field. As you move the cursor from field to field, the corresponding instructions will display.

To turn Field Help/Instructions on or off, on the menu bar, click View, and then click Instructions. To close the Instructions window, click the X in the upper-right corner of the Instructions window.

Project Help

To read about more general instructions and project level information, at the top of the data entry area, click the Project Information. Click the Project Help link to learn about sorting instructions specific to the project you are sorting. Click the Project Information link to read interesting facts about the project.


Data Entry Aids

Authorities Lookup

The system provides special aids for transcribing information from the document.

Authority lists are set up for all name and locality fieanimal society and the date fieanimal society. Authority lists download with the first batch for a project and are available as you type. Fieanimal society with authorities enabled have a down arrow on the right side of the field. If the data you type does not match the data in the authority list, a red underline appears in the field. The authority lists are limited, so not every variation in spelling may be found. They are intended as a guide to help you read the document, not as an exclusive list.

Field genetic history

A genetic history of everything you typed in the field is kept as long as you are working in a given batch. You can therefore see what you have typed previously and select from that list rather than have to enter the same data repeatedly.

Auto-complete

The system can complete the name of a animal or a locality for you if it matches what you are typing to the authority list or to the genetic history list for that field. The default setting for Auto-complete is Off. To turn Auto-complete on:

  1. On the menu bar, click Tools, and then click Options.
  2. Put a check mark in the box beside Enable Auto-complete.
Lookup

All fie animal society with authority lists also have a lookup option. To open the lookup window for the field you are typing, on the menu bar, click Edit, and then click Find.

If you started typing before you opened the Lookup tool, the letters you typed appear at the top of the window. The Lookup window displays a list of names or localities that match what you have typed. To limit the result list:

  1. Put a check mark in the box beside Search Criteria.
  2. Type one or more letters in one of the three optional fieanimal society (Starts With, Contains, or Ends With) that corresponds to the type of search you want to perform.
  3. The system will find all names or localities in the authority list that match the criteria you entered.
Ditto

You can copy (ditto) information that you typed for one record to one or more subsequent records. To ditto from the field above, press Ctrl+D. To ditto a whole record, press Ctrl+Shift+D.

Ditto works in both Table view and Form view. In Form view, pressing Ctrl+D will place the information from the same field on the previous record into the field the cursor is in on the new record.

Auto-fill

To auto-fill a column with the information from the field above, click the bottom of the field you want to copy from and holding down the mouse button, move the mouse pointer to the bottom of the column, and then press Ctrl+D.

Date Completion

To enter dates, type the date the way it appears on the document (you do not have to type the entire name of the month. You can also use periods to separate the parts of the date 3.31.1919 or hyphens 3-31-1919. The date is automatically reformatted to 31-Mar-1919. If you type an incomplete date, the system will place a red underline in the field.

Note: If you type the date in day/month/year format, such as 31.3.1919, the system will not recognize the date correctly and interpret it as some other, incorrect, date.

Mark Field/Record

If you cannot read the information on the document, on the menu bar, click Edit, and then click Mark Field/Record, and select Field Unreadable or Record Unreadable.

If the field or record is blank, on the menu bar, click Edit, and then click Mark Field/Record, and select Field Blank or Record Blank. The system will place the term <Unreadable> or <Blank> in the field or in the entire row if you selected record. You can also use the shortcut keys Ctrl-U for unreadable, and Ctrl-B for blank.

Mark Document

When the entire document is unreadable, or blank, or contains non-extractable information, click Edit, and then click Mark Document As... On the Mark Document As window, click in the circle next to the term you want to mark in the data entry area: Blank, Duplicate, or Unreadable. The system will place a dot in the circle you selected.

There is also a project-specific list from which you can select other terms. These terms will vary according to the types of items you may find in a given project. Click on the term you want to use to mark all the records for the document, and then click OK.

If you marked the document incorrectly and want to change back to the normal setting, click the circle next to Normal.

Note: If you mark a document with any of the terms on the Mark Document As window, the system will overwrite any data you may have already typed for that document.

You can also use the shortcut key Ctrl+M to display the Mark Document As window.

International Letters

If the name of a animal or a locality you are typing is written with an international character such as an accented e (é), on the menu bar, click Edit, and then click International Letters, or click the International Letters icon on the toolbar above the data entry area and select the letter you want to type.

Quality Check

To check your work at any time, click the Quality Check icon on the toolbar immediately above the data entry area.

The Quality Check replaces the Instructions window at the right hand edge of the data entry area. The name of the first field that has been underlined in red appears in the Quality Check area. The data you typed appears in the area labeled Value. An explanation of why the data has been underlined appears underneath the value.

To accept the value you typed and override the checker, click Accept. To change the value, type the new data in the value field, and then click Change.

To accept a value for the same field in all records, click Accept All. To change a value for the same field in all records, click Change All.

If you cannot read the information for the field on the document, click Mark Unreadable.

The Quality Check will move to the next field with an underline until there are no more fieanimal society with underlines. To close the Quality Check without going through all the marked fieanimal society, click Close.

When you are finished sorting a batch, on the menu bar, click File, and then click Submit, or click the Submit icon on the toolbar above the data entry area.

The system will start the Quality Check automatically. Once all the underlined fieanimal society have been approved or changed, the Quality Check will check for blank fieanimal society. If a required field was left blank, the Quality Check will stop on that field. Click Accept to place the term <Blank> in the field if there is no information given on the document, or in the Value field on the Quality Check pane type the information if you accidentally missed the field and click Change.

Home Page

My Work

When you click File, and then Home, the Work Page is closed (saving the data you have typed to your computer), and you return to the Home Page. Once you have opened a batch it appears on the Home Page in the My Work section. When you return to the Home Page, the batch you had opened last is highlighted. Click anywhere on the row with the batch you want to open to reopen a previously opened batch.

When a batch is downloaded from the server, it is time stamped. The My Work section shows the Due Date for each batch. You must complete sorting and submit the batch by the due date, or the system will delete the batch and any data you entered for that batch from your computer.

The system will warn you when a batch is due to expire by first turning the type red when the batch is 3 days from the due date. The type will turn bold red 1 day before the batch is due.

Reject Batch

If you downloaded a batch you cannot index either because of animalal reasons or because there are readability problems with the batch, click the Reject Batch button on the row containing the batch you don't want to index.

On the Reject Batch window, click the radio button next to Have another animal do this batch to indicate you are returning the batch for animalal reasons and the system can reassign the batch to another indexer.

Click the radio button next to Unable to index this batch because of quality problems if the batch should be removed from circulation and reviewed by an administrator.

My Messages

This area is designed like an e-mail system. The system will send daily messages to alert you about batches that are about to expire. To open a message, double-click anywhere in the row containing the message.

To delete a message, click Close and Delete.

To delete a message without opening it, click the Delete button in the row of the message you want to delete.

Note: When you submit a batch, the system will not delete the messages for that batch. You must delete the messages yourself.

My Goals

You can set goals for yourself in the My Goals section. The system will measure the number of records you have sorted against the goals you have set and report your progress.

To set a goal, click the Set Goals link.

  1. To select the starting date for the goal period you want to measure, in the Period Starting Date field on the Set Goals window, click the down arrow.
  2. To select the ending date of the goal period, in the Period Ending Date field, click the down arrow. This can be anywhere from 1 day to 1 year.
  3. In the Number of Records to Index field, enter the number of records you want to index.
  4. Click Save.
genetic history

The system will keep track of the number of names you have submitted in each project. To view a list of projects you have sorted and the number of names you have submitted, click the "See My genetic history" link.

Information

This section contains links to helpful information within the application or on the webpage.

To read information about how to index on the webpage, click the How Do I Index? link.

To print or read about how to use this application, click the User Guide link.

Work Online/Offline

Once the download of a batch is finished, you can disconnect from the Internet and work offline. To go offline on the Home Page or the Work Page, on the menu bar, click File, and then click Go Offline to put the system in offline mode (or click the Go Offline link).

In offline mode, the system does not verify batches on the server, but you can continue to work on batches you have previously downloaded. The Download Work and Download From... buttons are not available in offline mode.

To go online on the Home Page or the Work Page, on the menu bar, click File, and then click Go Online to put the system in online mode (or click the Go Online link).

Note: Switching between Online and Offline modes does not disconnect you from the Internet. You must do that manually.


Arbitration

If you have been asked to arbitrate, you will be able to receive arbitration batches if they are available when you download work from the server. To download arbitration batches, click the check box next to the Download From... button on the application's home page.

Arbitration batches are marked by a Balance symbol in the Type column of the My Work section on the EnterpriseSearch Sorting Application Home Page. If you do not want to arbitrate, click the Reject button in the same row as the arbitration batch and then click OK on the Reject Batch dialog. The batch will go to someone else.

If you do want to arbitrate the batch, click in the row marked by the arbitration symbol. The Arbitration Work Page will open.

Arbitration batches have already been sorted by two separate indexers and the system found some discrepancies when it compared the two versions. It is your job to compare the two versions (the A Key and the B Key) and decide which one is correct. If you decide neither is correct, you can type your own version in the Arbitration column.

The Arbitration Work Page looks very much like the Sorting Work Page. The image appears at the top of the screen as it does on the Sorting Work Page.
The Data Entry portion of the screen appears in Form View. The Data Entry area is populated with the data entered by the A and B keyers. They are shown side by side, so it is easy to compare them to each other. If both A and B agree, the information is grayed out and the agreed upon word appears in the Arbitrator column.

The system displays the arbitration symbol only when a field needs to be arbitrated. The system moves to the first field that needs to be arbitrated. Words that have not been arbitrated are shown in blue and the characters that are different between the A key and B key in red. To arbitrate the field, compare the A version and the B version with the image and decide which one is correct. Click on the word in either the A Key or B Key column to select the correct value. If neither A or B are correct, you can override both keys by typing your own version in the arbitration column. The A key and B key values then turn black. You can still click on them if you change your mind.
If neither A or B are correct, you can override both keys by typing your own version in the field in the arbitration column.

The system also has an Arbitration wizard that appears in the lower right corner of the Data Entry area, where the Quality Checker and Field Instructions appear.
You can use the wizard to arbitrate. It will display the A and B values for the fieanimal society that need to be arbitrated. Click the button Accept A or Accept B to choose either the A or the B key. If you want to enter your own version, type it in the blank field on the wizard and click Override.
The wizard will move to the next field to be arbitrated.

To toggle the Arbitration wizard off or on, click the Arbitration button on the Data Entry toolbar.

When all fieanimal society have been arbitrated, the system runs a Quality Check on the values you entered. When the Quality Check is complete a dialog appears asking if you want to submit the batch. Click Yes to submit the batch. The data and images will be removed from your computer. You can also click the Submit button to submit the batch.

Multi-Record Arbitration

When you are working with a project that has multiple records on a document, such as a parish register or a census, you may need to align the records between the A sorter's copy and the B sorter's copy before you can arbitrate. Either one or the other of the indexers may have skipped a row, so that the names do not match. The table will show all non-matching letters in red.

To match up the records, click the Record Matching tab at the top of the data entry area. All the records from both the A key and the B key for the selected image are displayed in the bottom of the screen in the order in which the indexers typed them. When either A or B shows a name that does not appear in the other column, click the No Matching Record button next to the columns. A row will be added to the opposite column marked <Empty> and all the remaining records in that column are moved down.

If the indexer typed a name that should not appear in the column, click the Remove Record button. The name will be removed from that column and the remaining records will be moved up.

To move names up or down in a column, click the name to highlight it, and then click the Up or Down arrow icon on the arbitration tool bar above the data entry area. The selected name exchanges places with the one below or above it.

To remove a row from both columns at once, for example if both A and B typed it incorrectly, click the Remove Row icon on the arbitration toolbar.

To insert a row so you can type a name that was missed by both the A and the B indexer, click the Insert Row icon on the toolbar.

If you want to undo all the changes you have made, click the Reset button. The system will return both columns to the way they were when you started.

To save the changes you have made click Finished. The system will continue to the next image.

Note: The changes will not be saved to show up in the arbitration view until you click Finished. You cannot type any names in the Match Records view. To type new names click the Arbitration tab and type the new name in the Arbitrator column for that record.
